subject: RE: [junit] Using JUnit with Kawa
msgSnippet: Hi Bob, I don t feel so lonely now. Dan MacKay
messageBody:
Hi Bob,

I don't feel so lonely now.

Dan MacKay


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bob Koss [mailto:koss@objectmentor.com]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 14, 2001 3:09 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Using JUnit with Kawa
>
>
>
> I'm experiencing the same thing. JUnit runs fine when started from the
> command line and it can find my tests nicely. I can add JUnit to kawa's
> menus. Clicking on the menu selection results in a no-op.
>
> ----
> Robert S. Koss, Ph.D. | Training and Mentoring
> Senior Consultant | Object Oriented Design
> Object Mentor, Inc. | C++, Java
> www.objectmentor.com | Extreme Programming
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Dan MacKay [mailto:dmackay@kingston.hummingbird.com]
> > Sent: Wednesday, February 14, 2001 1:26 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [junit] Using JUnit with Kawa
> >
> >
> > Hi Eric,
> >
> > Thanks for the reply. Junit is launching fine. When I go run any
> > of my test
> > cases or suites from JUnit when it is launched from inside Kawa
> it cannot
> > find the test class files.
> >
> > Dan MacKay
> >
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Erik Meade [mailto:emeade@geekfarm.org]
> > > Sent: Wednesday, February 14, 2001 1:10 PM
> > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: RE: [junit] Using JUnit with Kawa
> > >
> > >
> > > Dan,
> > >
> > > How are you using JUnit with Kawa? Did you set it up with:
> > > http://www.junit.org/kawa.htm ? Have you tried including
> > > junit.jar in your classpath env?
> > >
> > > --
> > > Erik Meade emeade@objectmentor.com
> > > Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
> > > http://www.junit.org
> > >
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Dan MacKay [mailto:dmackay@kingston.hummingbird.com]
> > > Sent: Wednesday, February 14, 2001 10:03 AM
> > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: [junit] Using JUnit with Kawa
> > >
> > >
> > > Hi all,
> > >
> > > Is anyone here using JUnit with Kawa and experiencing class not found
> > > errors? My test suites run fine if I run JUnit outside of Kawa,
> > or set the
> > > classpath globally to include the path to my test directory
> then restart
> > > Kawa.
> > >
> > > Is there no way of setting the classpath on a per project
> basis? I have
> > > already tried the project classpath option from inside of Kawa
> > and setting
> > > you test class output directory but for some reason it seems
> as if this
> > > classpath is not getting set prior to executing JUnit.
> > >
> > > Any suggestions would be appreciated.
> > >
> > > Thanks,
> > >
> > > Dan MacKay
> > >
